article_title: Free Tax Prep Available Starting Monday
article_text:
It’s time to start thinking about getting taxes done. And groups like the United Way and Care Community Center are working together to offer free tax preparation to those who are considered low income. But who qualifies as low income under the groups’ definition might be a bit surprising.

People making less than $58,000 qualify for getting tax experts to help out free of charge.

And new this year, the IRS has new procedures for handling the Affordable Care Act which could make filing taxes more difficult.

Experienced volunteers, trained by the IRS, will help sort through those issues and look to find the various credits and tax breaks available.

Here are just a few of the spots available to help out with free tax prep in Northwest Arkansas this year.

CARE Community Center

2510 N. 17th St., Suite 203, Rogers

Open January 26 - April 15

Monday - Thursday, 5:30 p.m - 8:30 p.m.



Center for Non-Profits NWA

1200 W. Walnut St., Rogers

Open January 28 - April 15

Wednesday - Saturday, 9 a.m - 4 p.m.



Genesis House

1402 N. Inglewood St., Siloam Springs

Open February 2 - April 15

Monday, 10 a.m - 2 p.m.



Fayetteville Boys & Girls Club

560 N. Rupple Rd., Fayetteville

Open February 3 - April 15

Tuesday & Thursday, 9 a.m. - 3 p.m.



Ridgeway Apartments

308 Ridgeway St., Huntsville

Open February 4 - April 15

Wednesday, 10 a.m. - 2 p.m.

article_metadata.author: Brad Carl

og.description: Several groups around the area are teaming up to help bring free tax help to those who qualify.
